meanings.definition: To check the backward motion or progress of.
meanings.sent1: She quickly backchecked her steps to make sure she didn't forget anything.
meanings.sent2: The coach always reminds the players to backcheck to prevent the opponent from scoring.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel backchecked its path when it realized it was going the wrong way.
meanings.sent4: His intuition acted as a backcheck, warning him of potential danger ahead.
meanings.sent5: Remember to always backcheck your work to catch any mistakes.

meanings.definition: A check or restraint on backward motion or progress.
meanings.sent1: The safety net served as a backcheck to prevent the acrobat from falling.
meanings.sent2: The emergency brake on the train acted as a backcheck in case of a sudden stop.
meanings.sent3: The backcheck on the door prevented it from swinging open in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His skepticism acted as a backcheck on her overly optimistic plans.
meanings.sent5: The password requirement serves as a backcheck to protect your personal information.
